item.description:
Boston Value Investing Group

This is our second Value Investing meeting. Anyone interested in Warren Buffett or Benjamin Graham-based investing is invited.

The meeting format is as follows:
  • Austin Sher will present Gannett Co. (GCI), a successful Warren Buffett purchase that exemplifies Buffett's methods. We suggest researching this company only up to 12/31/1993 (Buffett acquired a stake in this company in 1994). Our aim is to approach Buffet's decision with the same information that he had. The 1993 10-K can be found here: http://www.sec.gov/Ar...
  • Raimondas Lencevicius will present Harley-Davidson (HOG).
  • We have a 10 minute spot for a volunteer to present a 3rd company as a Buffett or Graham style investment. Please volunteer - let us know by email (axs888@yahoo.com or raimondas_l at yahoo.com) what you want to present.


Please read the financial statements and any historical information about the above companies beforehand. We will have in depth discussions about multiple aspects of these companies. Please prepare questions.

Additional information:
  • Graham: http://www.investoped...
  • Buffett: http://www.investoped...


We will meet at the entrance doors of MIT's Stata Center at 6:30pm. Specifically, the meeting point is the entrance to Building 32 (also known as the Gates Building) on Main Street and Vassar Street. The entrance doors are shown in the first 7 seconds of this video: http://techtv.mit.edu... . We will then use room G725 in the Stata Center. The doors are only accessible with an MIT card, so please arrive on time.

Here's a campus map showing the Stata Center.
item.name: Boston Value Investing Group
